data.title: some sentence examples
data.meta_description: How to use in-sentence of “Nobel prize”: – Haber had won the Nobel Prize for inventing a way to make ammonia from nitrogen and hydrogen. – He won the Nobel Prize in 1975 for his works in physics: he discovered the connection of the collective motion and the single-motion particle in the atomic nucleus, and … Continue reading "“Nobel prize” – some sentence examples"
data.text:
How to use in-sentence of “Nobel prize”:

– Haber had won the Nobel Prize for inventing a way to make ammonia from nitrogen and hydrogen.

– He won the Nobel Prize in 1975 for his works in physics: he discovered the connection of the collective motion and the single-motion particle in the atomic nucleus, and also for the development of the nuclear structure.

– Kornberg got the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2006 for studying eukaryote Transcription.

– She won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2009.

– Pierre and Marie Curie’s daughter Irène Joliot-Curie and their son-in-law Frédéric Joliot-Curie were also physicists involved in the study of radioactivity, and were also given the Nobel prize for their work.

Example sentences of “Nobel prize”:

– He was Dean of the Karolinska InstitutetKarolinska Institute Medical Department in Stockholm.”A Century of Nobel Prize Recipients: Chemistry, Physics, and Medicine”, ed.

– In fact, a Nobel Prize will be awarded to one who succeeds in making a room temperature superconductor.

– He received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1983.

– In 2008 he was awarded the Miguel de Cervantes Prize, “the Spanish-language equivalent” to the Nobel Prize in Literature.

– He was jointly awarded the 1978 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

– Up north from the square, the stock exchange built in 1776 and the Sweden Academy headquarters which selects the Nobel Prize winner are located.

– There are 29 Nobel Prize winners and three Fields Medalists amongst UCL’s alumni and current and former staff, the most recent being Sir Charles Kao, who received the Nobel Prize for Physics in 2009.

– Feynman diagrams are named after Richard Feynman, who won the Nobel Prize in Physics.

– Hubel was co-recipient with Torsten Wiesel of the 1981 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries about information processing in the visual system.

– Songwriter and poet Bob Dylan won the Nobel prize in 2016.

– She collected the Nobel Prize for Grameen Bank on 10 December 2006, at the prize awarding ceremony in Oslo City Hall.

– He won the 1967 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his work on the eye.

– In 1984, Stone received the Nobel Prize in Economics.

– He won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1921.

- He was Dean of the Karolinska InstitutetKarolinska Institute Medical Department in Stockholm."A Century of Nobel Prize Recipients: Chemistry, Physics, and Medicine", ed.

- In fact, a Nobel Prize will be awarded to one who succeeds in making a room temperature superconductor.

- He received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1983.

More in-sentence examples of “Nobel prize”:

- He received the 2013 Nobel Prize in Chemistry, together with Michael Levitt and Martin Karplus for "the development of multiscale models for complex chemical systems".

- The Australian Elizabeth Blackburn and the United StatesAmericans Carol Greider and Jack Szostak won the 2008 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their work on telomeres.

- Work at the Cowles Foundation gave Phelps the chance to meet with other important economists who were working on growth theory, such as David Cass and Nobel Prize winner Tjalling Koopmans.

– He received the 2013 Nobel Prize in Chemistry, together with Michael Levitt and Martin Karplus for “the development of multiscale models for complex chemical systems”.

– The Australian Elizabeth Blackburn and the United StatesAmericans Carol Greider and Jack Szostak won the 2008 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their work on telomeres.

– Work at the Cowles Foundation gave Phelps the chance to meet with other important economists who were working on growth theory, such as David Cass and Nobel Prize winner Tjalling Koopmans.

– The Division of Biology he started at the California Institute of Technology produced “seven” Nobel Prize winners.

– There has been at least one Nobel Prize winner from UCL every decade since the establishment of the Nobel Prizes in 1901.

– He won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1955 for his work on oxytocin.

– Huxley won the 1963 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Alan Hodgkin and John Eccles John Eccles for his experimental and mathematical work with Alan Hodgkin on the basis of nerve action potentials.

– He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his work in the PCR process.

– Shaw was the first person to win both a Nobel Prize in LiteratureNobel Prize and an Academy Award.

– In 1912, Einstein and Lorentz were nominated for the Nobel prize in physics due to their pioneering work on relativity.

– Meeting with Nobel prize winners Amartya Sen and Kenneth Arrow, and reading the work of John Rawls, whom he met during that year, gave Professor Phelps an interest to research outside of macroeconomics.

– She won the Nobel Prize in 2015 for medicine.

– Karle was a former president of both the American Crystallographic Association, as well as a co-recipient of the 1985 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his work on direct methods.

– He was given the 1927 Nobel Prize in Literature.

– He shared the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics with his wife, Marie Curie and Henri Becquerel, for the work on ‘spontaneous radioactivity’ which Becquerel discovered.

– Südhof, James Rothman and Randy Schekman won the 2013 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their work on vesicle trafficking.

– He was a Nobel Prize winner.

– Alphonse Laveran Charles Louis Alphonse Laveran, 18 June 1845 He won the 1907 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his work on the way protozoa can cause disease.

– His pioneering work on isotopes earned him the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1934.

– Kornberg won the 2006 Nobel Prize in Chemistry “for his studies of the molecular basis of eukaryotic transcription”.

– He shared the 1995 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

– The Norwegian foreign minister replied that the Chinese government complaint was not needed because the group of people who decide the Nobel Prize is independent from the Norwegian government.

– Watson, Crick, and Maurice Wilkins were awarded the 1962 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine “for their discoveries concerning the molecular structure of nucleic acids and its significance for information transfer in living material”..

– In 1988, she and her colleague, George Herbert Hitchings, received the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

– The Nobel Prize committee said, “the truly revolutionary aspect of the picture Kornberg has created is that it captures the process of transcription in full flow.

– There is no Nobel prize in mathematics.

– Johannes Fibiger Johannes Andreas Grib Fibiger, 23 April 1867 He won the 1926 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his discovery that an infection could lead to cancer.

– They won the 1981 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries about information processing in the visual system.

– John Bardeen, who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1956 and 1972, worked on the faculty of the university from 1951 to 1991.

– Each year on 10 December, the Nobel Prize party is held here.

– He shared Nobel Nobel Prize in Physiology or MedicinePrize in Physiology or Medicine in 1945 for this discovery with Howard Walter Florey and Ernst Boris Chain.

– For this work they shared the Nobel Prize in Physics for 1972.

– He won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1947.

– He was the winner of the 1994 Nobel Prize in Literature.

– Salinas is known for its vibrant and large agriculture industry and being “The Salad Bowl of the World” as the hometown of writer and Nobel Prize in Literature winner John Steinbeck, who based several of his novels there.

– The writer’s talent earned him endorsements for the Nobel Prize nomination from, among others, Nobel Prize laureates Joseph Brodsky and Czesław Miłosz.

– He was nominated for a Nobel Prize in Literature.

– Mikhail Aleksandrovich Sholokhov Mikhail Aleksandrovich Sholokhov was a Soviet UnionSoviet/Russian novelist and winner of the 1965 Nobel Prize in Literature.

– He won the Nobel Prize for developing an accounting model that could be used to track economic activities on a national and, later, an international scale.

– In 1973, he got the Nobel Prize in Literature.

– He was given the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1933.

– Two times he got a nomination for the Nobel Prize in Literature.

– Purdue has produced multiple Nobel Prize winners, CEOs of Fortune 500 companies, and NFL Super Bowl MVPs.

– He received the 1989 John von Neumann Theory Prize and the 1990 Nobel Prize in Economics.

– She is a Nobel Prize winner and of Jewish descent.

– Hall, he was awarded the 2017 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine “for their discoveries of molecular mechanisms controlling the circadian rhythm”.

– Blumberg won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1976.
